description.narrative:
Action Against hunger has interventions in various regions as follows:
Karamoja: In Karamoja, over time, Action Against Hunger has intervened in areas of Food security & livelihiods, WASH, Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Nutrition. Currently, Action Against Hunger is intervening in food security and livelihoods partnering with WFP in the NUSAF2 project in Kaabong District.
Northern Uganda: Action Against Hunger has worked for many years in support of populations internally displaced by the LRA insurgency. Over time, Action Against Hunger has had FSL, WASH, Nutrition and Cash transfers. Presently, Action Against Hunger implements an Agriculture Market Support (AMS) Project in Gulu, Nwoya, Omoro And Amuru.
Mid-Western Region: Improved prevention, detection and treatment of acute malnutrition in Kiryandongo refugee settlement with support from BPRM, SIDA and WFP.
West Nile Region: Improved prevention, detection and treatment of acute malnutrition in Adjumani and Yumbe refugee settlements with support from BPRM and SIDA (regular SIDA and SIDA Rapid Response Mechanism)
At the request of OPM & UNHCR, Action Against Hunger was one of the two nutrition actors (the other being Concern Worldwide) asked to intervene in Bidibidi settlement, Yumbe District, from the first day that refugees were settled there (3rd August 2016). Action Against Hunger now has an important presence in the settlement working in zones 1, 2 and 4 and soon in zone 5. Action Against Hunger is an implementing partner of WFP in Bidibidi settlement (Supplementary Feeding Programme) ensuring a stable presence in the settlement for the coming years.
